intro: Jacaratia costaricensis, commonly known as the Costa Rican Jacaratia, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. It is often found in tropical moist forests and is known for its ability to thrive in shaded environments. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
